text: Élahé, also known by the names Malipahpan and Maripahpan, is a Wayana village on the Tampok River in French Guiana. A minority of Teko also live in the village. == Education == A primary school opened in Élahé in 1985. == Geography == Élahé is situated about downstream the Lawa River from the village of Kawemhakan, which lies on the west bank of the river and hence is in Suriname. == Notes == == References == * * Category:Villages in French Guiana
title: Élahé
